articles.headline: Study of Drug for Blood Clots Caused a Stir, Records Show
articles.snippet: Many of the documents, newly unsealed by a court, centered on whether research would undercut a selling point: that the blood-thinning drug, Pradaxa, does not require regular tests.
articles.abstract: Many of the documents, newly unsealed by a court, centered on whether research would undercut a selling point: that the blood-thinning drug, Pradaxa, does not require regular tests.
articles.lead_paragraph: The makers of the blood-thinning drug Pradaxa were so worried that an internal research paper would damage drug sales that some employees not only pressured the author to revise it, but suggested it should be quashed altogether, according to newly unsealed legal documents.

articles.headline: User Growth for Twitter Starts to Slow, and Stock Dips
articles.snippet: The microblogging company said revenue for the quarter was $243 million, up from $112 million a year ago, and it reported a net loss of $511 million.
articles.abstract: The microblogging company said revenue for the quarter was $243 million, up from $112 million a year ago, and it reported a net loss of $511 million.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Twitter has finally acknowledged what any newcomer could have told the company within five minutes of signing up: The messaging service is too hard to use.

articles.headline: Narcissist’s Dream: Selfie-Friendly Phone
articles.snippet: Many smartphones have superb primary cameras, but the front-facing cameras that we (well, some of us) use to take pictures of ourselves are inferior.
articles.abstract: Many smartphones have superb primary cameras, but the front-facing cameras that we (well, some of us) use to take pictures of ourselves are inferior.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Selfie” was Oxford Dictionaries’ word of the year in 2013. And selfies are powerful business; #me is the third-most-common tag on Instagram, appended to more than 184 million photos, according to the app’s Web viewer, Webstagram. (Numbers 1 and 2 are #love and #instagood.)

articles.headline: Tech Industry Flexes Muscle in California Race
articles.snippet: The race in the 17th Congressional District in California underscores the tech industry’s push to elect candidates who will further its interests, even if it means trying to replace a party stalwart with a relative unknown.
articles.abstract: The race in the 17th Congressional District in California underscores the tech industry’s push to elect candidates who will further its interests, even if it means trying to replace a party stalwart with a relative unknown.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUNNYVALE, Calif. — Here in the land of technology start-ups, Ro Khanna is its political version. Backed by many of Silicon Valley’s top investors and executives at Google, Facebook, Yahoo and other tech companies, Mr. Khanna, a 37-year-old patent lawyer who has never held elected office, has mounted an aggressive campaign for the seat from the 17th Congressional District in the heart of the Valley.

articles.headline: A Different Gates Is Returning to Microsoft
articles.snippet: After years in philanthropy, many wonder how Bill Gates, a luminary of the tech world, will choose to position Microsoft going forward.
articles.abstract: After years in philanthropy, many wonder how Bill Gates, a luminary of the tech world, will choose to position Microsoft going forward.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — The last time Bill Gates played an active role at Microsoft, as chief software architect, he witnessed the company muffing its earliest efforts to become a major player in search, smartphones and tablet computers.

articles.headline: Jihadist Return Is Said to Drive Attacks in Egypt
articles.snippet: Egypt has been largely insulated from the Islamist violence in the region, but it is now facing increasing terrorism as Egyptians return from jihad abroad to fight the country’s military-backed government.
articles.abstract: Egypt has been largely insulated from the Islamist violence in the region, but it is now facing increasing terrorism as Egyptians return from jihad abroad to fight the country’s military-backed government.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — In just the last two weeks, Islamist militants have detonated a car bomb at the gates of the capital’s security headquarters, gunned down a senior Interior Ministry official in broad daylight and shot down a military helicopter over Sinai with a portable surface-to-air missile.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Ukraine Chief Loses Support in Stronghold
articles.snippet: The defections of two prominent businessmen in eastern Ukraine, a stronghold for President Viktor F. Yanukovych, signal growing frustrations with him even among his base.
articles.abstract: The defections of two prominent businessmen in eastern Ukraine, a stronghold for President Viktor F. Yanukovych, signal growing frustrations with him even among his base.
articles.lead_paragraph: DNEPROPETROVSK, Ukraine — As violence flared late last month in Kiev after Parliament approved a draconian law against dissent, two of the richest men in this industrial city 300 miles to the east of the Ukrainian capital met in an expensive Italian restaurant that they own and made a fateful decision.

articles.headline: Subdued Send-Off, but Jay Leno Is Exiting on Top
articles.snippet: Despite the diminished state of late-night television, and technology that has altered viewing habits, the “Tonight” show remains one of the signature franchises of broadcasting and still carries unusual resonance.
articles.abstract: Despite the diminished state of late-night television, and technology that has altered viewing habits, the “Tonight” show remains one of the signature franchises of broadcasting and still carries unusual resonance.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jack Paar left the “Tonight” show in 1962, he passed through a set of curtains and the camera zoomed in on a card that read: “No More to Come.” Three decades later, Johnny Carson had Bette Midler serenade him on his penultimate show, then sat and spoke directly to his fans in his emotional finale, watched by 42 million viewers.

articles.headline: After Losses, Yet Another Overhaul for Sony
articles.snippet: The company, struggling to keep pace in consumer electronics, said it planned to sell its Vaio PC unit to an investment fund and cut 5,000 jobs.
articles.abstract: The company, struggling to keep pace in consumer electronics, said it planned to sell its Vaio PC unit to an investment fund and cut 5,000 jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — After failing to turn around two of its most troubled consumer electronics businesses, Sony is pushing them aside.

articles.headline: Rise in Profit for G.M., but Europe Unit Falters
articles.snippet: G.M. has changed its management team and made major strides in its core North American market, but the nation’s biggest automaker is still struggling in Europe.
articles.abstract: G.M. has changed its management team and made major strides in its core North American market, but the nation’s biggest automaker is still struggling in Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — General Motors on Thursday reported its 16th consecutive profitable quarter — but consistent losses in its troubled European division continued to hurt its results.
